name: benzylamine
Reason: Benzene, as the basic unit, has a melting point of 5.5 degrees Celsius. The presence of an amine (NH2) group typically lowers the melting point due to destabilization of the crystal lattice and hydrogen bond donation abilities, which interfere with the regular stacking of the molecules (-20). A CH2 (methylene) group connects the amine to the benzene ring, and this group slightly increases the structural rigidity of the molecule (+5).
